author: lightclient
content: <@892053833121923094> sina noticed that in the genesis for the consume rlp tests, TTDpassed is true but the forks are configured where we start out in PoW (i.e. berlin / london start at 2000)

author: lightclient
content: i would have expected all the pow works to begin at genesis if ttd passed is true - does that make sense or do we misunderstand something?

author: lightclient
content: i.e. https://hive.pectra-devnet-5.ethpandaops.io/viewer.html?suiteid=1737978251-e64d859366c5b722d1091756009244cb.json&suitename=eest%2Fconsume-rlp&testid=3981&file=results%2Fgo-ethereum_prague-devnet-5%2Fclient-b6a8dbd02619f741d0520d0f542e736f7ee48e165f4873a81c9221fb27ea1b21.log

author: .fjl
content: the idea with TTDpassed field is just to configure the client with the assumption that the merge has already happened *at chain head*

author: .fjl
content: we introduced this field back in the day to enable PoS based sync on the chain

author: .fjl
content: if we know the merge is already over and effectively final, we don't need to bother trying to confirm the PoW validity

author: lightclient
content: right good point

author: lightclient
content: they also set TTD to 0 though, which shouldn't be possible with non-zero pow fork blocks?

author: .fjl
content: yeah that's weird then

author: .fjl
content: the TTD should be the real TD at the merge block

author: .fjl
content: not that it matters much anymore, since we don't verify it

author: .fjl
content: (or do we?)

author: lightclient
content: seems geth is still at least checking the difficulty is non-zero even if TTDpassed is true

author: marioevz
content: Hey sorry about the delay, let me take a look why is this happening, I agree it doesn't seem right üëç

author: marioevz
content:
I think it is expected in these cases that the Berlin and London fork an non-zero, because the test is filled for Istanbul, so a couple of things:
- We can limit these devnet tests to not run anything pre-Cancun
- In the case of pre-fork rlp hive tests, what should the value be for TTD ? (We could simply set it to a really high value)

author: marioevz
content: PR with fix is up: https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/1135
